Text:
First...I'd like you to briefly tell me what you know
about the Cult of Diablos.
So you won't need to reiterate what we already know?
...They control this world from the shadows.

They abduct those who are possessed and use them as
test subjects, to serve some purpose.

They have deep ties with the Church and a tenuous
relationship with the Templars, who serve as the
Church's inquisitors.

Above all, the Cult's structural powers are so
vast that even their subordinates cannot obtain
satisfactory intel on its workings... Something
along those lines.

...If you know all that, it wouldn't be a stretch to
say you're more knowledgeable than any other
outsider concerning the Cult.

Even more so than those of the aristocracy, which the
Cult has deeply infiltrated!
Who told you all of this?
We're the ones asking the questions.
A slime sword!

The Cult of Diablos has been active in the shadows of
history since ancient times.

They even played a significant role in the formation
of the Velgalta Empire.

As I recall, until the unification of the Empire,
many local lords were vying for power.

They say there were frequent skirmishes between the
lords throughout the continent.

That's right. And none of the hidden details have
been recorded in the history passed down amongst
the people.

...For example, the fact that aristocrats like the
Herzog Family, who became pawns of the Cult,
played an important role?

Everyone was exhausted by the wars that raged on
across the continent...until the land was finally
unified under the Velgalta Empire.

And most of the lords lacked ambition, willing to
serve any ruler so long as they were guaranteed
autonomy.

The Cult effortlessly infiltrated the inner circles
of such aristocrats.

The Herzogs were one of the aristocratic families who
accepted the power of the Cult and submitted to them.

So, as the head of such an aristocratic family, you
were born a member of the Cult?
...Control works best when it goes undetected.

Besides, when war breaks out, the common folk of the
land are the first to suffer.

My ancestors understood what needed to be done to
avoid unnecessary bloodshed.

That's why the Herzog Family has long played their
part in maintaining peace within the Velgalta Empire,
restraining those brash individuals who only seek
conflict, and protecting the lives of their people.

That's the typical arrogant mentality of those who
control others.
Arrogant, you say?!

I'm not wrong, am I? You're depriving the people you
claim to protect...the opportunity to walk on their
own two feet and grow.

The opportunity to grow? That's nothing more than an
idealistic notion! Not everyone can possess power and
lead the lives they desire!

So you'll deny people the chance to fail? Surely
that's the epitome of "controlling" them.

And you yourself are being "controlled." After all,
you're acting out the will of the Cult.

Not only that. Despite being fully aware of what is
happening, you genuinely believe you are correct in
your thinking...

You've turned your back on your beliefs and boast
about the shackles that bind you, urging others to
wear them as well... You are a slave to power.
...Say what you will.

I...my family...believed it was the best way, and we
have fulfilled our duty as the Herzog Family until
now.

But that duty no longer exists, does it? I heard
Sergey annihilated your entire family.

Who is this Sergey? Is Velgalta's Seven Blades itself
an organization of the Cult?
No, that's not the case.

Velgalta's Seven Blades is a title given to knights
highly regarded in the Empire for their pure martial
prowess and ability to utilize it.

...And Sergey Gorman is a knight who dueled and
defeated one of Velgalta's Seven Blades, who also
was one of the "Children," earning him both titles.
One of the "Children"! You also called him that.

Being a large organization, I guess it's natural for
the Cult to have words indicating positions within
its hierarchal structure.

I'll be blunt. Do you know who is at the head
of the Cult?

There are individuals who are known as the "Knights
of Rounds," or simply the "Rounds," who are members
of the Round Table Committee...

...in charge of determining the Cult of Diablos'
policies and governing its central operations.

The Rounds! So you're saying the Cult is
controlled by a collective, not an individual?

Even my long-standing aristocratic family lacked
knowledge about who the Rounds are, how many
there are, or the details of their hierarchal
structure.

It's a secret organization where even aristocrats are
treated as underlings...

The four Rounds known to the Herzog Family are
"Fenrir," "Loki," "Hel," and "Jormungandr."

It seems they each hold a specific rank, but I am
only aware that Fenrir is ranked "Sixth of the Round
Table."

They all match the names of the factions of the Cult
in Midgar Kingdom.

Perhaps because of conflicts between the Cult's
factions in Midgar, even many of their subordinates
know their names.

I heard you were called a "Child." Is that also some
sort of title within the Cult?

...Those of us who possess power and serve the Cult,
such as I did, are generally called the "Children of
Diablos."
Children!

There are distinctions between the First, Second, and
Third. Those below the Third are treated as ordinary
members or foot soldiers of the Cult.

Those who were born and raised Children, like me, and
those who joined the Cult and became Children, like
Sergey, are rare.

More common is finding orphans with no relatives or
children of poor commoners with high magic aptitude
and raising them in special facilities.

This is because they undergo rigorous combat
training, educated as members of the Cult, and
administered drugs to enhance them.

Well, that's one way of putting it. In other words,
the orphans and children are abducted from their
homes and brainwashed through education and
drugs, correct?

Th-That may be true...but we're not like other
aristocratic families and subordinate organizations!

The Herzog Family merely offers a means of escape
from poverty by becoming a Child—

Let's give you the benefit of the doubt and say it
was all done out of the goodness of your heart.
You're still essentially saying you only save those
with talent.

You're selecting lives to be saved based on practical
conditions before even considering whether they want
to be saved.

Tsk... You're thinking in ideals yourself! People are
not that intelligent!

Now, now... So what do the different ranks for the
Children mean?

......The Third is a general term for Children whose
minds couldn't withstand the enhancements. They
are soley used for basic combat.

You mean, because they're mentally broken, there's no
risk of them leaking intel?

Still, even those Children possess combat abilities
far surpassing your standard knight.

The Second Children are those with stable mental
states. Most of the Cult's leaders belong to these
Second Children.

And the First distinguishes Children like me...
who possess undeniable strength.

Are there any individuals among these Children who
become, for example, members of the Rounds?
...It is said there are.

Children who show promise or make significant
contributions to the Cult are given two titles and
are referred to as "Named" individuals.

Most are First Children, but some are Second Children
who become Named.

Within the Cult, becoming Named is said to be a
gateway to joining the Rounds...
Wait...is Sergey...? But he can't be!

Training Children while dangling the position of
power known as the Rounds... It's precisely what
those in control would do.

You've been raised in an environment that blinded you
to the contradictions inherent in those actions...

Or perhaps you knew how distorted that hierarchical
structure was but turned a blind eye in order to
reap its benefits.
Karen, First Child of Diablos, the Shooting Star.

As a token of appreciation for sharing intel with us,
we'll give you time to reflect on yourself.

I'm sure your experience as a possessed has helped
you understand the reality that the Cult's domination
of the world is built on lies and deception.

If you're willing to discard everything that has made
you who you are until now, then we're ready to
welcome you as a member of the Garden.
...That is if you really can discard everything.
Um!

Lambda. While she remains our guest here, treat her
accordingly.
Yes sir!

Come along now, you who were once Lady Karen. If
you're going to do any thinking, you'll need a place
to sleep, won't you?
Mnhh...
